content: The increased loss can be summarized as a result of $96,000 higher gross profit offset by an increase in insurance, primarily directors and officers related to being listed on NASDAQ of $444,000, $810,000 greater investment in research and development without the benefit of $706,000 in grants and subsidy income related to COVID-19 and $1.019 million higher in – higher share based payment expense, and $443,000 in unrealized foreign exchange gains related to cash held in our U.S. dollar accounts at the end of July.
